Introduction

The Single-cell Schemas website is developed by the Collaborative OPen Omics (COPO) project team based in Norwich, United Kingdom, to support two main research areas:

  • Single-cell Ribonucleic Acid Sequencing (Single-cell RNA Sequencing)
  • Spatial Transcriptomics with a focus on:
    • Sequencing
    • Fluorescence In Situ Hybridisation (FISH)

Follow these steps to navigate the site effectively:

  1. Select a standard and a technology from the dropdown menus on the left of the web page.
  2. If data is available for your selection, the contents in the centre of the web page will automatically update to reflect the matching data.
  3. If no data is available, a modal will notify you.
  4. You can download a blank manifest related to your selection if data is available for it.

Why is only partial Sample metadata shown?

The Sample worksheet in each Single-cell manifest contains only a minimal set of metadata fields. Similarly, the Sample accordion on this Single-cell website displays only the recommended fields based on the chosen standard and technology. This is designed to help users focus on the essential information needed for their single-cell experiments.

However, many other sample-related metadata fields may be required, depending on the sample type to submit. If you are uploading data via COPO, we recommend that you first complete and upload the relevant sample manifest. This ensures that all necessary fields â€” such as biosampleAccession, scientific name, organism and taxon ID - are associated with a valid, previously submitted sample.

For a full list of available sample manifests, please visit the Manifests page on the Collaborative OPen Omics (COPO) website. For more information on Single-cell submissions, please refer to the Single-cell submissions guide .

Please note that the blank manifests available on the Manifests page do not contain any pre-filled sample metadata. If you have already submitted samples through COPO and received BioSample accessions, log in to COPO and navigate to the Single-cell component. From there, you can download a blank manifest with pre-filled sample metadata specific to your submission.
